page.title: 04The Village Of Hewish
page.content:
Hewish is a village on the main A 370 road from Bristol to Weston-super-Mare. In the square we studied there are ten residential houses, two working farms, one filling station, one guest house, one car body repair shop and one garden centre. Many vehicles use the main road and we have made a count of them during school time. Many trains use the main line from Bristol to the West Country. Last month (June 1985) a steam train passed our school to celebrate 150 years of the Great Western Railway. Hewish is mainly a farming community with the land being used to raise sheep and cattle.
Samantha Denmead, St. Annes' School Hewish.
